roleset.name: to get lucky
roleset.note: LUCK_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in wsj-nw. Framed by Claire. (from luck.01-v)

example.name: All (one) args
example.text: Our mammalian forerunners lucked out through the extraterrestrial impact that did in the dinosaurs because they were small , not smart .
example.arg: through the extraterrestrial impact that did in the dinosaurs
because they were small , not smart .

roleset.name: fortunate, beating the odds
roleset.note: LUCKY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, conceptually related to luck-v.01. (from lucky.01-j)

roles.note: The verb frame treats the stroke of luck as MNR because of the way it is syntactically realized. Here, it makes more sense to use an arg2. (from lucky.01-j)

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: I was lucky to be there for this glorious sunset on Siesta Key Beach
example.arg: to be there for this glorious sunset on Siesta Key Beach

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: 'I feel Miami is lucky for me'
